ratings.comment: This class is inundated with a ridiculous amount of work for 3 credits, the most egregious being the 20 SINGLE SPACED pages of essays you have to write for the final "exam". The class is a lot of regurgitating the textbook she wrote (and made us pay for), and her grading comments are passive aggressive and jab-like. Stay away w a 6 foot pole.

Supposed to be a relatively easy 3 credits for non-science majors and Graham makes it hard as hell for no reason. The class was supposed to be weekly online quizzes with one lab per week. Instead, without putting it on our schedules (some people had to drop), she set up a time for in-person quizzes that were about long readings. DONT TAKE IT

The worst course I've ever taken. Basically this course is about to get all the textbook read. No lecture at all. More than 50 pages of reading per week and a quiz of cherry-picking questions that sabotaging your grade. Nice TAs, but there's nothing they can do to help you get into this course and have a nice grade. AVOID THIS COURSE AT ALL COSTS!!

She get's the bad grade because she clearly only teaches the class to sell her textbook that she forces you to purchase. I got the gradfe that I wanted, but I had to work far too hard for a 100 level course. I spent at least 25 hours of week on a 100 level botany class to get by. DO NOT TAKE. TA's are perfect tho, love those guys

Straight up, just do not take this class with Dr. Graham. She's very egotistical and goes out of her way to retaliate against students that hurt her ego. By that I mean modifying quizzes with irrelevant material to sabotage students' grades. Pathetic excuse of a professor.

Professor Graham reads the textbook in lecture. She is very passionate about Botany, but does not teach very well, or at all for that matter. This class was required for me and I wish they had another professor teaching it because Professor Graham was terrible. Beware of weekly quizzes on Fridays and no exams.

Prof. Graham reads directly from the textbook she wrote. No PPT. Lectures are very hard to follow and she said that her quiz will only be based on the Learning Objectives which is not true. She test on random thing that you can find in the textbook but you wont think that is important when you read it.

Prof Graham reads straight from the textbook in class that she wrote, but doesn't go into any detail. You would think this would make the quizzes she gives every Friday easy to pass, but she puts random things on them that you could only possibly know if you went to lecture.

She reads directly from textbooks in lecture and is all over the the place. She could be very hard to follow. Her quizzes are ok first half of semester, but it gets way harder and unpredictable in the second half. She tests you almost nothing from the learning objectives but many questions are on matching scientific name of plants with description.

Prof Graham reads through the titles of the online textbook, without much detail, barely anyone goes to lecture, except Friday when there are quizzes. She gives us learning objectives for quizzes but they don't cover the material that's on the quiz. The hard cover textbook is not useful. Lab is way better, but it's like a whole other class.

This is a very writing heavy class (10 four page exam essays and weekly worksheets), but all the writing makes getting an A very easy. In lab, Linda and Marie are extremely helpful and give great feedback. Linda is incredibly committed to teaching her students practical writing and science skills. I'd definitely recommend taking a class with her.

Algae is both a lab and Comm B, and the TEN 4-pg essays you'll write don't let you forget. The class itself is extremely chill labwork (flipped so almost everything is due outside of class), but there's a ton of writing and deadlines. Aside from that, grading is firm/fair, you'll learn buckets, and Linda and Marie are wonderful, enthusiastic profs.

While she's a nice person, the "blended learning" format picked for this year and the future was absolutely trash. It involved no lectures, but self-reading for the weekly 10-question quiz that typically involved 3 chapters that were around 60 pages of specific information and small text. Look elsewhere for an easy bio class.

This semester, Botany 100 was a "blended" course, which apparently means that students are responsible for reading her textbook and taking weekly quizzes instead of attending a lecture and taking midterms. The readings were often long and tedious, and the quizzes cherry-picked specific details from her textbook. The lab was mandatory and boring.

Literally reads right off the book in class. She is all over the place when she teaches and so is her book which is the required text for this class. If you have to take this class, go to lecture for extra credit and read the chapters on your own. You can literally tune her out, that's how bad her teaching style is.  You have to teach yourself.

This class was very hard to take, the lectures are 75 minutes long, and it feels like the longest 75 minutes of your life each class. She reads directly from her textbook she wrote and it contains way more information than is needed for the class so it makes it very hard to know what to study. Do not take this class.

She just reads straight from the book. Its extremely long and horribly boring but she gives out a LOT of extra credit. The tests are really tough and most people average around a 70% but with extra credit its doable.

I would definitely recommend this class! The lectures are VERY boring, but she gives extra credit that directly applies to the tests. I got an 70 on a test, but since I had 25 points of extra credit it was bumped up to a 95. The labs are also really fun and easy and basically as long as you show up for lab you will get a 100 for lab section.
Go to lecture, it's boring but there is extra credit almost every lecture. As long as you kind of pay attention and go to lab every week you'll pass the class no problem!

This is probably the easiest bio credit you can get at this school. Linda gave out extra credit in like half the lectures, labs were fun, lectures were horrible and boring but you go for the extra credit. She literally pulls the book up on the screen and reads from it for 75 minutes, as long as you read the book you can zone her out the whole time

The lectures are incredibly boring, she just reads from the textbook. The tests are somewhat hard, but she gives A TON of extra credit so even if you get a C on all the tests you can still end up with an A. It's definitely a drag, but if you just go to lecture for the extra credit you will be okay.
Easiest class I've ever taken. Linda gives extra credit away like it's candy. Show up to this class answer the questions at the end and you're basically guaranteed and A.

She's great, don't let the reviews fool you. Class was an easy A. You get 20 points extra credit for each exam if you go to lecture. I got above an 80 on each exam without the extra credit so with it, I got perfect 100's on each test. Easiest lab credit on campus.

She is the nicest prof I ever had on this campus. She will take as much as drafts for take-home exams, lab-reports, and final projects, which are all essays! She does a great job of explaining the world of algae and they are all interesting even if I was not a botany major. She has a bit of annoying voice though. Take her class and you won't regret
Class was an easy A. Not the greatest professor as the lecture is boring, but she is nice and gives plenty of extra credit opportunities.
NOT an easy A by any stretch of the imagination. Sure you get a lot of extra credit, but hardly anyone got above a 70 on any of the exams. Linda Graham is not a cute old lady, she is the devil.

I had Prof. Gilroy for the first portion so it made this professor seem really boring. She's passionate about the material, but she can move quickly. She wasn't too helpful during the reviews and I felt there were a lot of ambiguous questions on the final.

Not too interesting a lecturer, but the class wasn't bad.  My only problems with her: sometimes moves way too fast through ppt slides, didn't give us enough time for one exam, and sometimes words exam questions really terribly/ambiguously.  I studied hard and did okay/well on her exams, but I'd say she was alright
Extremely boring lecturer. All she does is read off slides.
She is an ok lecturer--passionate about the material, but very boring and annoying voice to listen to.  Overall, not too difficult in terms of exams.

Linda's lectures are very helpful: she's very clear about what she wants you to know, and her explanations are easy to follow.  Test questions are reasonable.  She moves a bit quickly through the material, so you need to pay attention to keep up.

This class was one of the easiest I've ever taken.  She gives 5 points of extra credit each week, so you can get 20 points extra credit on each exam.  Lectures are pretty boring, but she's a funny lady.  Take this class if you're looking for an easy A and fulfillment of biological sciences.
Exams were hard. She offers extra credit during many lectures so that its hard not to get an A.

People say she's a really tough professor, but if you just show up to lecture, she tells you all the questions on her exam. Write down every word she says in lecture because those are always test questions. It's obvious which diagrams will be on the test too. The grade I got on her test was the reason why I got an A in the class...

Don't listen to the freshman who took 151 w/ her, Linda is amazing.  Algae is an easy, fun class.  Not a ton of work, and grading is incredibly lenient.  She wants you to get an A, and will take as many drafts of your midterm and final as it takes for you to get 100%.  She's about the nicest person in the world and knows EVERYTHING about algae.

She is a horrible lecturer. Be prepared to here "You should have learned this already" all the time.  She always tells you to just read the text book.  Her exam was hard but it was scored so that a 40/50 was a 100%. Don't bother going to lecture, just look at the powerpoint slides and read the book.
Not worth going to lecture, she just tells you to read and know everything out of the corresponding chapter of the textbook that SHE helped write

HORRIBLE!!! She wants you to know EVERYTHING..even the stuff she mentions in passing..well, even the stuff she DOESN'T mention..her exam was hard, long, wordy and questions were ambiguous...AVOID her at all costs! her appearance is deceiving - appears to be a nice old "grandmotherly" type..but is really the devil
Professor Umbridge in a giant nutshell, absolutely terrible teacher, story problems that are rediculous, makes you know every minute detail

Just to continue from the last rating, Dr. Graham's test is tricky. The questions make you second guess yourself. 70% of the questions are easy, but the questions are all story problems (like you might see on the MCAT).  You need to know your**** and be confident.  If you guess, you'll prob be wrong.  Overall though, she was a decent professor.

I just took Dr. Graham's Evolution and Diversity Exam and it was ALL from lecture. The key is that a lot of the info in written on the powerpoint or was presented orally. If it wasn't said in lecture, you don't need to know it. Read the book as a review, but her test is all from lecture. Trust her when she says the exam is from lecture.

Very easy class. Gives away extra credit like it's candy. The exam averages were low but at least half the class must be getting an A. Labs are extremely easy. And...everyone with an A is exempt for the final. Only problem is the boring lectures.
Very tough test, and terrible lecturer. Boring and doesnt get points across, but rather babbles on for 50 mins. Spawn of Satan. Avoid at all costs

Lecture was almost poitnless because she talked so freakin' fast. It was also hard to learn during lecture because you have to focus on writing down everything she put on the overhead. You MUST READ THE BOOK to do well!! but she does love biolgy...if that's worth anything
Taught straight from the book.  Read before you go to lecture otherwise it's pointless because she doesn't define topics well.  Test was very tricky and our class had a low average.

She really knows what she's talking about, but that's also the problem. It's hard to keep up with her lectures if you don't already have some basis on the material.  You have to READ THE TEXTBOOK. I can usually get by without that, but I had to for her.  When I was studying, I ONLY used the lecture notes to TEST myself because they were so unclear.

She really knows and loves algae. She wrote the book on it! Very nice, very helpful, you never knew you had a passion for algae until you took her class. She's one of the best professor's and scientists we have.
She is really nice and gives you a chance for 5 extra credit points by just coming up with a question for her every friday! If you need a lab, take this class!
